message:
SYSTEM: FernandezM.Feb2019.pdf: Página 39
Conclusions
1 Scarcely ever an ontology is maintained by a company that
commercialises the reuse of the ontology.
2 An ontology being maintained and updated by a community similar to
those of free software is not frequent either (exceptions are, e.g.,
W3C ontologies).
3 In consequence, a candidate ontology to be reused may not reach
minimal adoption requirements or it may not be always available
online (as shown in the results).
4 In addition, many ontologies do not include an explicit declaration of
their license [Poblet et al., 2016].
5 Another important issue detected concerns the assumption of English
as lingua franca.
6 They take as reference conceptualizations of the Anglo-Saxon world.
Fern´andez, Poveda, Su´arez, G´omez
Ontology reuse across the same domain
February 21, 2019
39 / 43
speaker: SYSTEM
